intro: Bdallophytum americanum, commonly known as the American sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white or pale blue flowers. It is often found in open habitats such as prairies and coastal dunes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
